phanfic 162647049017 "2017-07-05 23:45:00 GMT" http://phanfic.tumblr.com/post/162647049017 "Hello everyone! Seeing as we are getting new followers each and every day
column2: we thought it would be a good idea to remind everyone about prompts.We take prompts here; little ideas that fill your brilliant minds but for some reason
column3: you decide it would be better if someone else wrote it. We think itâ€™s wonderful we have so many because that means that there is an endless amount of creativity being shared from readers to writers. However
column4: as we get more and more followers
column5: more and more prompts come in and we end up deleting some which make people sad.The only reasons we would delete prompts are as follows;1. They contain slurs/derogatory terms: I really donâ€™t want to have to explain this one
column7: we will receive prompts that contain slurs/derogatory terms and we refuse to publish them. If youâ€™re not sure whether or not a word is a slur (it probably is if you have to think about it)
column8: just send us an ask off anon so that we can help you word it appropriately.2. They are too vague: saying you want some phan angst just isnâ€™t enoughâ€¦neither is phan angst where they fight. A proper prompt would say something likeÂ â€˜Phan angst where Dan and Phil are getting annoyed at each otherâ€™s little quirks (Dan dropping papers behind tables
column10: etc.) but they keep letting the little things slide. However
column11: one of them reaches a tipping point and starts listing off all the things the other does wrong. They fight and say things they donâ€™t mean
column13: decide to apologize and make up.â€™ You want to be a little bit specific so that the authors have something to go off of. Help them out and they are more likely to publish the fic you want to read!3. They are repeats: I know youâ€™re eager to see your prompt be published
column14: but please be patient! While all the admins work hard to keep the ask box under control
column19: etc. that we need to tend to. Please keep in mind that we are people too and we get busy just like you so it might take some time before you see your prompt published.4. They are obvious crack!fics: we love joking around as much as the next person
column20: but when we have an ask box full of well-intentioned prompts
column21: itâ€™s not fair to the people waiting to have to readÂ â€œlolzor
column22: dan n fil shove a whole fukin cake tin up their bums 4 sexii times~â€. It takes time for us to read them when we could have spent that time reading and tagging another ask or prompt. Again
column23: we have lots of stuff outside phanfic and when we have to waste time with silly prompts like that
column24: prompts that many people would like to see published end up getting buried." True text
